alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 3:49PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FAYETTE AND NORTHWESTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 349 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 7 miles northeast of Greenfield. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Frankfort, Lattaville, Austin and Plano. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
